page.title: 19INTERESTING PEOPLE, SEAMILL
page.content: {Mr Macrae}is the{cemetery warden}and he says that he hasn't seen a ghost, nor does he believe in them. He says that people don't die on a regular basis but on average there are about 54 funerals a year. His job is mainly burying the dead. He also visits the cemetery each night to make sure that everything is quite all right. This tends to deter vandals. The{oldest {grave}in the cemetery is that of John Simpson and Mary Morris who were buried in 1863. Mr Macrae has been working there for fourteen years and has only had one accident: he fell through two coffins whilst putting the third one in the ground!{ Mr Hugen} is the local{policeman.}He works different shifts, i.e. early, back shift and night shift. He says there are{very few serious crimes.}He finds his work enjoyable and interesting.
